answers.answer: Im with you on this one. I eat something sweet everyday. Ive always had a big sweet tooth. I cant live without chocolate!! Haha

I feel you. I eat very well all my meals have meats and veggies and fruit is always my snack but at night I love ice cream or something sweet! The other day I got a snickers bar out of the machine at work and someone actually said something about watching all the sweets for both my waistline and the health of the baby. I almost feel over I am active I go to the gym and eat healthy it is crazy that people think I'm not allowed to indulge a little I mean if not now when I'm pregnant then when?

I agree pol. I drank 1 coke (and sometimes a 16 ounce coffee) every single day during my pregnancy.  My daughter was born healthy as can be...I'm really healthy too. Every time I got blood work done,  everything was great.  Women overreact.  Even my dr said, don't stop enjoying things in life Because you're pregnant.  It's not an illness lol....you don't need to avoid sugar or caffeine.

Pfffeeew! I almost regretted posting this because I was afraid I'd just get negative feedback. I mean  eating a whole chocolate cake I get or if a person is severly overweight or had GD there should be a little caution i get. but I guess what really bothers me is that the society we live in has forced People into believing those little things we do or don't do make us a bad mom, or endangering the health of our babies.  PS. I would of told the person that commented on your Snickers to shut their face lol
I totally agree. I dont think sugar is bad at all as long as it's in moderation.  I try to avoid artificial sweeteners.
Moderation indeed. At first my husband said no sugar at all, but for 9 months, it's a little unreasonable. I have sweets in moderation. Life changes when pregnant, but it doesn't need to stop!
I feel the way u feel I also have a sweet tooth I love my sugar nd cake. I'll go crazy if I dnt get it..
I feel the way u feel I also have a sweet tooth I love my sugar nd cake. I'll go crazy if I dnt get it..
I have a sweet tooth but I have to be strong willed and not eat too much because I gain weight so easily.

:-) this post made me smile. Everything is about moderation. I seriously laugh when people post they feel bad for having a few pieces of candy or a bite of cake etc. I definitely don't wanna gain tons of weight but if I want pizza then I have pizza. I balance that meal with my other meals. :-) and a bowl of icecream isn't gonna hurt the baby. :-) of course, just my luck my lil guy isn't happy if I eat sweets...makes me sick. Lol but he loves carbs! Haha... Thanks for this post! I needed a smile today.

there is a risk to sugar, I have counted many many posts on her related to Diabetesand the rates of type 2 diabetes in children have been sky rocketing - it used to only occur in seniors, they used to call it "old age diabetes"1 coke = 150% daily allowance of sugar according to the WHO

The thing is many people overindulge.  You also have to consider that by the time they want sweets, they have eaten a lot of hidden sugar. Sugar is added into everything from cereal to spaghetti sauce. Most people aren't making foods from scratch or reading labels so by the time they indulge in that piece of cake or ice cream, they have already gone over the recommended amount of sugar for the day. It is easier for people to identify sugar in sweets than in everyday food items. Our society needs nutrition lessons.

people will find fault in ANYTHING you post on here.no one is perfect.. it's either too much sugar, too much salt, too much blah blah blah!you know your body, you & your OB knows what's best for you and your baby, just do what's best and/or okay for you!I worked HARD to get to the weight I'm at (122 lbs.) because of my colon disease, and a little extra cake & ice cream probably helped! if it wasn't for sweets, I wouldn't or couldn't have eaten most days. my business is no one else's business, and I'm HEALTHY! my baby boy is healthy.. there's too many doctors on this website/app - I listen to the REAL doctors that I PAY to see at home, not on here!! lolp.s. enjoy your sweets. you'll be okay. I don't feel bad at all about anything I eat.. it's not like I overdo it. I still eat plenty of protein, meats, vegetables, fruit, etc. nothing wrong with ice cream every night if I want it.. I haven't gained a pound. good luck!! (((:

question: I don't understand why people are so scared of eating a bite of cake or a couple pieces of candy. I have a sweet tooth and always have, I eat sweets EVERYDAY! Either a small bowl of ice cream or maybe a chocolate muffin after dinner. Mind you, I eat extremely well aside from dessert, fruits vegetable lean meat etc.  Im healthy, and so ismy baby. I just find it odd that people deprive them self's of a yummy treat when pregnant but turn around and eat a fast food 3 nights a week (gross) but what brothers me more is when they post about it and people say "yes sugar is bad, you shouldn't even drink juice, you should drink crystal light instead" (seen that about 3 times) crystal light??? That sh i t should be banned, not only does it hold no nutritional value but its made of artificial sweeteners? Where's the logic ? I may just be in a bad mood, and annoyed. Am I the only one that feels this way? Don't getme wrong, I'm all about being healthy and ensuring baby is healthy, but it cracks me up people think twice about  sweet but  think its okay to drink or smoke pot?
title: sugar and sweets! *rant*
